answers.answer: Have you been diagnosed with diabetes???  Sounds like your current issues are more anxiety related and it may help to seek out professional counseling.

It sounds to me like you may have some post partum depresion.  I suffered from simular anxiety and panick attacks for almost a year following my first mc.  I would think it would be good to speak to your dr., just to make ure things dont get out of control.  If not, it usually passes after a few weeks.  About the diabetes, I have no idea.  I was horrified to read about your mc experience in HongKong.  That must have been truly traumatic:(:(  Try to keep your spirits up. Like all things, this too shall pass. (((HUGS)))

question: I had my second miscarriage 6 weeks ago.  the first was 14 m ago from ectopic. the last was 11wks gestation but babe died at 9wks. i was very thirsty throughout the whole preg and have continued to be thirsty following mc. i also had a lot of weight gain during and following mc. could my mc been from mature onset diabetes.i also have had anxiety symptoms following mc because i lost babe in hong kong under stressful circumstances - no english, husband home in australia, no support, had my 7 yr old son with me. i now prod and pick up 23mth old daughter during night to make sure alive, i panic when i hear an ambulance if i am out and kids at home, i feel nervous in stomach all the time, i don't sleep well.  i know these symptoms are of post traumatic stress disorder or acute stress disorder, but could they be normal post mc symptoms too?i appreciate your help.
title: could my miscarriage be caused by mature onset diabetes
